content.body: And some of that should be testable using .labels, since that should point to (through retargeting) only to label elements, and if one uses then id attribute with non-labels, the list shouldn't contain those elements.

* And some of that should be testable using .labels, since that should point to (through retargeting) only to label elements, and if one uses then id attribute with non-labels, the list shouldn't contain those elements. Or label's control or something

content.body: Hi folks, Ladybird have just become aware of the California OOPS requirement (https://cppa.ca.gov/announcements/2025/20250911.html) but we're having trouble finding any technical definition of what is required. Does anyone here know if that is covered by supporting GPC, or is it a specific header we should be sending?
